events.text: Welcome to the Function Event sheet, where 99% of all gameplay and menu functions are located. The only functions which aren't located here are those who don't make sense without their context.

events.title: Player Functions
events.description: All the functions related to the Player.

children.title: Init Player Functions
children.description: All the Player function which are essential to the game init.

children.functionDescription: This function essentially moves the Player and his whole apparatus to a new Layout. There are various actions necessary in order for these objects to move together in the proper way.

functionParameters.name: X
functionParameters.comment: X coordinate either taken from the DEFAULT_SPAWN_X global value or from the Dest_X value of the last TP object collided by the Player.

functionParameters.name: Y
functionParameters.comment: Y coordinate either taken from the DEFAULT_SPAWN_Y global value or from the Dest_Y value of the last TP object collided by the Player.

actions.text: Stops all Attacks. Used to prevent a bug, but I think this old bug cannot occur so the PlayerStopAttack function might be deprecated here.
Resets the Player's animation to 'Idle'.
Move the Player and all of his apparatus.
Pins the various means of transportation to the Player.
Makes the Health bar of the player visible.
Moves the PlayerSword to a random point around the Player (defined by one of the image point from 2 to 5).
Player is ready.

children.title: Move Player Functions
children.description: All the functions for Player movement.

children.functionDescription: This function verifies if the adjacent space targeted for Player movement is empty. If the Player is jumping, bypass all the checks.

functionParameters.name: Axis
functionParameters.comment: String which indicates if the Speed parameter should be applied on the X or Y-axis in the sub-function PlayerMove..

functionParameters.name: Mirror_State
functionParameters.comment: String which indicates if the Player should be mirrored or unmirrored or left unchanged.

functionParameters.name: Speed
functionParameters.comment: Value of the Speed to be used in the sub-function PlayerMove. Currently can be set to (-)16 or 32 and is determined by the current state of the Player transportation.

children.text: This constant is the cooldown between movement checks.
If an enemy's turn is underway, the player cannot move. This mostly prevents the Player from moving while the enemy is attacking.
If the Player isn't jumping, a whole set of checks need to occur to verify if the adjacent targeted space is empty.
I'll only be commenting this axis as both X and Y branches are symmetrical.
Setting the mirroring state of the Player and Transportations (regardless of player movement for smoother animation). If the Mirror_State parameter is left empty, doesn't change anything.
Likewise, I'll only be commenting the first block as all successive ones are similar but with variable values.

actions.text: By putting this part outside the adjacency check, I'm making sure the sword always reorients even if the player does not move.

children.text: Verifies if the Player is adjacent to an obstacle or enemies.
Performs an additional check when using a transportation.
Verifies if the Player is adjacent to a NPC that hasn't been killed.
Verifies if the Player is adjacent to a NPC that hasn't been killed.
There are none of these checks while the Player is jumping.
Setting the mirroring state regardless of player movement for smoother animation. If the Mirror_State parameter is left empty, doesn't change anything.
Likewise, I'll only be commenting the first block as all successive ones are similar but with variable values.

actions.text: By also putting this part outside the adjacency check, I'm making sure the sword always reorients even if the player does not move.

children.text: Setting the mirroring state regardless of player movement for smoother animation. If the Mirror_State parameter is left empty, doesn't change anything.
Likewise, I'll only be commenting the first block as all successive ones are similar but with variable values.

actions.text: By also putting this part outside the adjacency check, I'm making sure the sword always reorients even if the player does not move.

children.functionDescription: This sub-function of the PlayerVerifyMovePossibility moves the Player a value along a direction on the X or Y axis. It also takes into account the Tallgrass object or water in unique animations.

functionParameters.name: Axis
functionParameters.comment: String which indicates if the Speed parameter should be applied on the X or Y-axis.

functionParameters.name: Speed
functionParameters.comment: Value of the Speed. Currently can be set to (-)16 or 32 and is inherited from the PlayerVerifyMovePossibility function.

functionParameters.name: Wait_Duration
functionParameters.comment: Value used in the delay between the steps of the move animation.

functionParameters.name: NewEnemyTurn
functionParameters.comment: Boolean which determines whether a new enemy turn will proc.

actions.text: I am not using a Behavior for basic movements (besides the Platform Behavior for jumping), because I want to combine turn-based with real time moves and VFX.
This boolean makes it so only a single move command can be issued simulatenously.

children.text: Sets the walk animation
This part changes the animation if the Player is in a Tallgrass patch or water (half-frame animations).

children.title: X Player Movement
children.description: All the codes for the X movement. X movement is simple. Since speed is sometimes negative (-), we can just say "+ Speed" and it'll switch to negative by itself when appropriate.

children.title: Y Player Movement
children.description: All the codes for the Y movement.

children.text: Y movement needs to be written this way to prevent the PlayerHolderMove function from moving the player upward by 32 px rather than 16 px.

actions.text: By this function the player is naturally carried up by 16 px.
Only while jumping will the player truly move. This is to allow synchronicity to arise between the Player and PlayerHolder during the jump animation.

children.text: The PlayeHolderMove function is called after the potential player Y movement.
Touch visual gamepad animation.

actions.text: The Wait_Duration parameter is prevent multiple movement when the key is pressed down.

children.text: If this boolean if true, triggers a turn for the enemy.

actions.text: Resets the Moving boolean and allows a new move command to be issued if needed.

children.functionDescription: This function sets the Player's Direction instance variable to a specified value.
This function triggers a Jump typical of the Platform Behavior.

actions.text: The initial boolean prevents simultaneous Jump functions.
Disables the Player (and thus all move/attack) during the "pre-jump" animation.
Disables PlayerObstacles to allow Jump platform mechanic to execute properly.

children.text: This part changes the animation if the Player is in a Tallgrass patch.

actions.text: Plays a Jump SFX.
The resolution of this Function is in the Player "On Landed" call within the Animator Event Sheet.

children.functionDescription: The function makes the player bounce if he has landed on a blocker and it can chain indefinitely.

children.text: The local number chosen randomly determines the random direction of the hop.

children.title: Fighting Player Function
children.description: All the functions for Player attacking, damage taking, etc. (aka fighting).

children.functionDescription: This Function activates the appropriate PlayerBlade Sine Behavior based on the AttackOrientation (aka the Player's Direction). It uses a Boolean to prevent excessive triggering of the function. The PlayerSword will also rotate faster (240 degrees) during this Function's duration.

actions.text: The Attack_Orientation parameter is based on the Player's direction (defined by the last pressed movement key or button).
The initial boolean prevents simultaneous Attack functions.
Plays a variant of the Attack sfx.
Allows the sword to detact from the Player.
Activates the rotation over the specified duraiton.
Activates the bullet behavior of the PlayerSword.

children.text: Gives the appropriate angle of motion to the PlayerSword base on the Attack_Orientation parameter.

actions.text: In all cases the behavior is a sine.
Wait this duration before reversing the angle of motion.
In all cases the behavior is a sine.
Wait this duration before triggering the PlayerStopAttack function.

children.functionDescription: This sub-function resolves the PlayerAttack function by restoring the player's sword to its initial status.

actions.text: Resolves the PlayerAttack function by restoring the PlayerSword to its default state.
Attach the sword to the Player.

children.functionDescription: This function makes the player lose 1 from his CurHP is he isn't already Immune.

functionParameters.name: Pushback
functionParameters.comment: A boolean that determines if the Player is pushed by the attack to a random adjacent empty tile.

functionParameters.name: Damage
functionParameters.comment: The amount of damage done to the Player is equal to this integer.

functionParameters.name: Source_UID
functionParameters.comment: A parameter for the UID of the source of the attack.

functionParameters.name: Source
functionParameters.comment: This string is used to define the type of attack source (Enemy, Car, Obstacle, etc.)

actions.text: This boolean prevents multiple damage ticks from occuring.
Deals X
Creates the blood vfx and flashes the player.
This wait is to let the Hurt animation play out.

children.text: If the player has 0 health, trigger the PlayerDeath function.

children.functionDescription: This function triggers the player's death.

functionParameters.name: Type
functionParameters.comment: This string makes reference to the type of death, thus allowing special deaths to display, for example, an incongruous animation.

actions.text: Deactivates the player controls.

children.text: Depending of the Type of death, triggers animations or various VFX or SFX.

children.functionDescription: This function pins the various means of transportation to the Player sprite.
This function makes the Player's transportation visible based on his EquippedTransportation variable.
This function removes all transportations.

children.title: Interact Player Function
children.description: All the function for Player to NPC or object interactions.

children.functionDescription: This function verifies if there is an INTE object next to the Player, which would trigger an appropriate Interact function.

actions.text: Loads the slide and memory to be used from the previous logic path.
Sets the logic for the next interaction.
Triggers specific cases if any (where a specific dialog must be shown --  based on the GlobalChecks ES).

children.text: Unless a cancellation has been called, checks if an interaction is already underway.
If the Player is already interacting, use the NextInteraction function to proceed to the next logic step (based on the Storymap.json file).
Otherwise, the main difference is that the Interact function will spawn the graphics for the dialog bubble.
->Cancel

children.functionDescription: This function checks if the player is adjacent to a NPC or interactable object and triggers the appropriate reaction (most likely, a dialog bubble).

functionParameters.name: INTE_Database_ID
functionParameters.comment: This integer corresponds to the ID or the Z value of the Dialogs.json database where the dialog text is located.

functionParameters.name: Spawn_Graphic_X
functionParameters.comment: X coordinate where the dialog should be placed.

functionParameters.name: Spawn_Graphic_Y
functionParameters.comment: Y coordinate where the dialog should be placed.

functionParameters.name: Type
functionParameters.comment: The Type of DialogBubble to use.

functionParameters.name: Memory
functionParameters.comment: Corresponds the the Memory variable on the INTE, which equates the Y value of the Dialogs.json database where the dialog text is located.

functionParameters.name: Slide
functionParameters.comment: Corresponds the the Slide variable on the INTE, which equates the X value of the Dialogs.json database where the dialog text is located.

actions.text: This boolean prevents multiple interaction from occurring simultaneously.

children.text: Since the DialogBubbles are on a global layer, they simply need to be picked according to the INTE-defined Type parameter, which refers to the instance variable of the same name of the DialogBubble graphics.

actions.text: Makes the picked graphic visible, as sometimes the graphics is make invisible.
Sets its position to the INTE-defined X and Y coordinates.
Creates the text making a reference to the DialogData array loaded from JSON in the Init Event Sheet that is ran at the start of the game.

children.functionDescription: This function triggers the next dialog or a choice for the player, depending.

functionParameters.name: INTE_Database_ID
functionParameters.comment: This integer corresponds to the ID or the Z value of the Dialogs.json database where the dialog text is located.

functionParameters.name: Memory
functionParameters.comment: This integer corresponds to the ID or the Z value of the Dialogs.json database where the dialog text is located.

functionParameters.name: Slide
functionParameters.comment: Corresponds the the Slide variable on the INTE, which equates the X value of the Dialogs.json database where the dialog text is located.

actions.text: Similarly to the above function, the PlayerNextInteraction sets a new text for the dialog.

children.functionDescription: This function interrupts the Player's interaction.

actions.text: Hides the dialog and pointer.
Disables the Choice controls.

children.functionDescription: This sub-function checks for logic cases in INTE interactions before resolving the PlayerVerifyInteractPossibility function.

events.title: PlayerHolder Functions
events.description: All the functions related to the PlayerHolder. The PlayerHolder is an invisible platform on which the player is standing at all time. It allows us to create the illusion of depth in this game.

children.functionDescription: This function move the PlayerHolder by X px along a direction on the Y axis. It is a sub-Function of the PlayerMove function. When used towards the Up direction, it carries the Player along with it over 16 px.

events.title: Audio Functions
events.description: All the function related to the Audio object which is responsible for preloading and playback of SFX and music, including voice recordings.

children.text: This string variable should stay where it is, as it is a bridge between the AudioPreloadSFX and AudioPlaySFX functions.
The preload can be used to load bigger files in time or to fix sound sync problematics.

children.functionDescription: This function preloads a variant of an SFX chosen between two values. This preloaded SFX will be played rather than the SFXName in the next PlaySFX function to allow exact match of the sound variants.

actions.text: Functions like the normal branch of the AudioPlaySFX function (where the variable ChosenSFX is empty). Sets the ChosenSFX variable for a further use in the next AudioPlaySFX function and preload that sound.

children.functionDescription: This function plays a variant of an SFX chosen between two values.

children.text: Checks if an SFX has been chosen for preload (allows more precise playback of the audio in using the PreloadSFX function first.)
Else just play the SFXName parameter.

actions.text: Resets the ChosenSFX variable to empty.

children.functionDescription: This function plays a music by its specificed title. Otherwise it plays the MUSIC globals which is Overworld.

events.title: VFX Functions
events.description: All the functions related to the VFX objects which are spawned from various points of origin in the game.

children.text: CreateNew Function. Creates a VFX on the Player or an Enemy.

children.functionDescription: This function create a new VFX from the Player, an Enemy or an NPC.

functionParameters.name: VFX_Name
functionParameters.comment: The name for the VFX to be spawned.

functionParameters.name: Source_UID
functionParameters.comment: The UID for the source of the object if it isn't the Player itself.

functionParameters.name: Source_Is_Player
functionParameters.comment: A boolean that indicates if the Player is the source of the UID.

children.text: Creates a VFX based on the specified name in parameter.
Selects whether the blood will spawn from the Player or the enemies.
Both branches of the function are the same and I will only comment the first one.

actions.text: Gives a random mirror orientation to the VFX from this integer.

children.functionDescription: This function fades out any current zone title and initializes the ZONE variable to a given value (=to the instance variable on a NewZone overlapping the Player).

functionParameters.name: NewZone_UID
functionParameters.comment: An integer parameter for the NewZone object that triggered this function.

functionParameters.name: TPTransition
functionParameters.comment: A boolean parameter that determines if the function has been triggered by a TP object instead.

children.functionDescription: This subfunction of the SetForZoneTitleTransition function makes the zone title fade-in and types it. Also sets the music.

functionParameters.name: NewZone_UID
functionParameters.comment: An integer parameter for the NewZone object that triggered this function, inherited from the VFXSetForZoneTitleTransition function.

functionParameters.name: TPTransition
functionParameters.comment: A boolean parameter that determines if the function has been triggered by a TP object instead, inherited from the VFXSetForZoneTitleTransition function.

events.title: Enemy Functions
events.description: All the functions related the enemies, in the sense of masks. NPCs will use similar functions although I'm still in reflection about this.

children.text: In many of these functions, the UID of the specific enemy is transferred as a parameter.

children.functionDescription: This function makes the enemy attack by activating a Sine Behavior with either a Horizontal or a Vertical movement for X seconds.

children.text: Checks that the enemy hasn't been killed meanwhile.
Different attacks are possible based on AIs.

actions.text: Sets the EnemyTurn boolean to true, thus preventing the Player from taking an action during this "animation".
This is the only way to get the animation the way I want.
END OF ANIMATION.

children.text: Preload and plays the sound effect.

children.functionDescription: This sub-function executes and wraps the enemy Attack.

children.text: Checks that the enemy hasn't been killed meanwhile.

children.functionDescription: This function makes an enemy lose X from his CurHP if its not already Immune.

functionParameters.name: Target_UID
functionParameters.comment: An integer parameter for the UID of the targeted enemy.

functionParameters.name: Damage
functionParameters.comment: An integer parameter that is equal to the amount of damage taken by the enemy.

actions.text: This boolean prevents the enemy from taking further damage until the wait duration below expires.
Play the sound
Spawns a blood vfx.
Flashes the enemy.

children.functionDescription: This function makes an enemy check if its possible for itself to move.

functionParameters.name: Enemy_UID
functionParameters.comment: This integer parameter is equal to the UID of the enemy whose's current turn it is (and that thus triggered this function).

functionParameters.name: Given_Direction
functionParameters.comment: A string which, if non-NULL, is used to set the CurDirection variable (which indicates the targeted direction for the next enemy's move).

children.text: If there is a NULL Given_Direction string, pick a NextDirection for the Player at random from the four possible directions.

actions.text: Set the CurDirection to that pick.
Otherwise just use the Given_Direction parameter as CurDirection.

children.text: Move the enemy is a specified direction.
If the square targeted is not empty, loses the enemy's turn. (I would like to find a solution to that design restriction).
If the enemy can't move it just skips its turn.

actions.text: Play the sound

children.text: Based on the Axis parameter, applies the Speed.
After each enemy movement, all enemy check their adjacency again.

actions.text: The whole logic of this function has been commented to facilitate understanding.

children.text: Enemy is above player.
Enemy is right of Player.
Enemy is left of Player.
Enemy is right of Player.
Enemy is above player.
Enemy is below player.
Enemy is below player.
Enemy is right of Player.
Enemy is left of Player.
Enemy is left of Player.
Enemy is above Player.
Enemy is below Player.

children.functionDescription: This function verify the adjacency of an enemy.

children.text: Up
Left
Down
Right

events.title: General Functions
events.description: All the functions used by the System or whole Program, such as the GameInit function.

children.functionDescription: This function initializes the game when it is lauched.

actions.text: I should verify is this is useful.
Set the HP to its maximum value.
Sets up the Player position on the overworld map.
Sets the NEW_GAME global boolean to False.

children.functionDescription: This function sets the cursor sprite for the Mouse. It is also a sub-function of the GameInit function.
This function requests fullscreen.

children.text: Checks the version of the export.

children.functionDescription: This core sub-function of the EnemyTurn function updates the MonsterSpawner objects in the vicinity of the player. It is therefore, the branch of the enemies' turn which deals with spawning.

children.text: Verifies for each MonsterSpawner if it is within range of the Player AND active.
If the cooldown for spawing is at zero, spawns an enemy.
If there isn't any monster remaining to be spawned, put the MonsterSpawner's Active boolean to off.
Else it means we should spawn an enemy and all that it entails.

actions.text: Sets the enemy HP.
Sets the enemy position to be near the spawner.
Substract 1 from the variable. When it reaches 0, it sets the spawner to unactive for a while.
Resets the cooldown.

children.text: Else, reduce the cooldown by 1.
Verifies if any MonsterSpawner is inactive and has both of its enemy slain.
If the cooldown for reseting is done, resets the monster amount in the MonsterSpawner and the other variables.
When a MonsterSpawner has more than 0 monster remaining, it becomes active.

events.title: Menu Functions
events.description: All the functions used in menus.

children.functionDescription: This function initializes aspects specific to the menus.

actions.text: Sets the SpriteFont of buttons to black.

children.text: This part runs a series of checks to determine if the game is running on mobile.

children.functionDescription: This function quits the game to the desktop.

children.text: If the Touch menu control-type is set, plays the animation that usually plays before in other control-modes.

children.functionDescription: This function moves the currently selected spot on the player's inventory.

functionParameters.name: Key_Input
functionParameters.comment: A string parameter which indicates which key has been pressed by the player.

functionParameters.name: Previous_Selection_ID
functionParameters.comment: An integer which indicates which "ID" (column) the previously selected spot from the player's inventory belonged to.

functionParameters.name: Previous_Selection_Row
functionParameters.comment: An integer which indicates which row the previously selected spot from the player's inventory belonged to.

children.text: First, verifies if the Close inventory button is selected. If so, the whole logic is treated differently in the tree below.
Pressing up will select the seventh spot above the Close inventory button.

actions.text: This animates the button.

children.text: If the spot contains an item which belongs to the player, the name of the item appears and a SFX is played.
Pressing left will select the spot left of the Close inventory button.
Else if the Close inventory button isn't selected...
This works like the block presented before.

Pressing a Key input will check the previous ID and row and in this way determine the new spot to select. A boolean is checked so that is an item is held in that spot its name is displayed and a SFX played.

children.functionDescription: This function displays the appropriate equip selector VFX based on the selected spot from the player's inventory when the function is triggered.

functionParameters.name: Selection_Equip_Group
functionParameters.comment: An integer which indicates which group the currently selected spot from the player's inventory belongs to. The group is associated with the color for the equip selector VFX and it is used in the code.

functionParameters.name: Selection_UID
functionParameters.comment: This integer is the UID of the selected spot from the player's inventory.

functionParameters.name: Selection_Item_Name
functionParameters.comment: This string parameter indicated which item is associated with the currently selected spot from the player's inventory.

children.text: Pick the VFX with the same EquipGroup as the one of the UIInventorySpot.

actions.text: Move it to the spot.

children.text: Sets the picked objet in the UI bar.

children.functionDescription: This function closes the menu.

functionParameters.name: Key_Input
functionParameters.comment: A string parameter which indicates which key has been pressed by the player.

functionParameters.name: Previous_Selection_ID
functionParameters.comment: An integer which indicates which "ID" (column) the previously selected item from the shop belonged to.

functionParameters.name: Previous_Selection_Row
functionParameters.comment: An integer which indicates which row the previously selected item from the shop belonged to.

children.text: First, verifies if the Close shop button is selected. If so, the whole logic is treated differently in the tree below.
Else if the Close shop button isn't selected...

events.title: Button Functions
events.description: All the functions related to buttons, where they lead (and where they come from :D).

children.functionDescription: This function is triggered when a button is pushed or released (depending on control-type).

children.text: Pick the current hovered (state=1) button. (In the touch control-type state 1 is equal to a pressed button.)

actions.text: Set the button to state 2 (=triggered).
Wait for the StateAndAnimation function to end.
Go to the destination.

children.functionDescription: This function sets the first button of the main menu to state 1 when a keyboard or a gamepad is turned and no button is already at state 1.
This function changes the state of a specified button by X.

children.text: The TARGET string
The functionning of buttons is divided by LayoutNames.

In the main menu, since there are four buttons there is a cycling mechanics which is put in place. The Orientation parameter defined by the key (either up or down) pressed designs the specific order of targets that is accurate with the graphical design of the menu.
Selects a button based on the TARGET string (itself defined by the original button selected).
If the origin button's state is back to 0 (encompassed in parameter Origin_Button_Current_State).

actions.text: Sets the targeted button (=TARGET) to the specified New_State parameter.

children.functionDescription: This sub-function of the Active function changes the state of the button and its Y value for 0.25 seconds.

actions.text: Moves the button on the Y axis.
Changes its states (which affects the color of the spritefont over the button).
Restores the button to default.
Signals for the Activate function to resume.

children.functionDescription: This function animates the Inventory button when it is selected. It functions differently since this button can only be selected in-game (with keyboard or gamepad).

actions.text: Moves the button on the Y axis.
Changes its states (which affects the color of the spritefont over the button).
Restores the button to default.

children.functionDescription: This function animates the visual gamepad's D-pad between 2 said frames.

children.text: Verifies the player speed and plays the appropriate animation of the visual gamepad's D-pad.

events.title: Cinematics Functions
events.description: All the functions related to cinematics.

children.functionDescription: This function types out a new line from the first sheet of the Dialogs.JSON file.
This function moves to a frame or by 1 frame forward or backwards.

actions.text: Sets the frame to +- X, defined by the multiplication of the two parameters.

children.functionDescription: This function ends the current cinematic by moving to the layout equal to the destination parameter of the cinematic UI button.

events.title: Health Bar Functions
events.description: All the function related the HP bars of enemies and players alike.

children.functionDescription: This function initializes an HP bar for the Player or an enemy. The bar is made invisible except under certain circumstances.
This function hides a specificed HP bar.
This function makes visible a specified HP bar.

events.title: Dialogs
events.description: All the functions for the spawning and updating of dialogs' graphics and text.

children.functionDescription: This function uses AJAX to load the JSON arrays into the Array object of C3, allowing us to pull the data for our dialogs.

actions.text: Load Dialogs.
The wait delays are necessary as AJAX loading is not instantaneous.
Load Dialogs logic.
Load Saved choices (MORE WORK NEEDED HERE TO MAKE IT WORK WITH LOCALSAVE)
Load Dialogs timings.

children.functionDescription: This function spawns the Text used in a dialog box and sets its properties.

functionParameters.name: Text
functionParameters.comment: This string parameter contains the text to be displayed in the dialog. It is loaded from a JSON.

functionParameters.name: Type_Speed
functionParameters.comment: This integer parameter is the speed at which the text has to be typewritten.

functionParameters.name: Dialog_Spawn_X
functionParameters.comment: An integer for the X-coordinate at which the dialog text must be spawned.

functionParameters.name: Dialog_Spawn_Y
functionParameters.comment: An integer for the Y-coordinate at which the dialog text must be spawned.

functionParameters.name: Box_W
functionParameters.comment: An integer parameter for the width value the dialog text box should be set at.

functionParameters.name: Box_H
functionParameters.comment: An integer parameter for the height value the dialog text box should be set at.

actions.text: Spawns a new Text.
Sets its Type to "Dialog" (makes it useable for the rest of Dialogs functions).
Style adjustments.
Sets the W/H of the Dialog text box.
Typewriter text.
Wait and typewriting speed are the same.
Adjust the Height of the dialog text box.

children.functionDescription: This functions sets a new text for the currently spawned dialog.

functionParameters.name: Text
functionParameters.comment: This string parameter contains the text to be updated in the dialog. It is loaded from a JSON.

functionParameters.name: Type_Speed
functionParameters.comment: This integer parameter is the speed at which the text has to be typewritten.

actions.text: Typewriter text.
Wait and typewriting speed are the same.
Adjust the Height of the dialog text box.

children.functionDescription: This funciton sets the INTE next move based on the data in a specified position of the Storymap array. The array mimicks the Dialogs array but only provides the NextMove values for the whole dialog.

actions.text: Sets the INTE's Next_Action to a keyword amongst many defined within the DialogsExecuteLogic function. In the Storymap JSON, each step of a dialog is defined by a logical keyword.
Executes the set action. Also conserves the NPC UID so as to prevent errors.

children.text: Verifies that the NPC is on the correct Layout before triggering the action.
No choice.
Choice
Opens a Shop interface.

actions.text: Jumps to the next Y in the story.
Set the Shop layer to visible.
Sets the Shop controls to true.

children.text: Buys an item by checking directly from a Speech bubble (no Shop interface, i.e. when buying the Skateboard).
This part sets the Cash requirement to buy the item.

children.name: Buy_Amount
children.comment: An integer variable that defines which amount has to be payed.

children.text: Go to a specified Y-coordinate in dialog based on the previous choice.
This action activates a Choice on the dialog following choice 1.
This action activates a Choice on the dialog following choice 2.
Adds or subtract a specified amount to the X-axis.
Adds or subtract a specified amount to the Y-axis.

children.name: Y_Jump_Amount
children.comment: An integer variable that defines how much to add to the Y-axis.

children.text: Go to a specified X.

children.name: X_New_Value
children.comment: An integer variable that defines the new Y value.

children.text: Go to a specified Y.

children.name: Y_New_Value
children.comment: An integer variable that defines the new Y value.

children.text: Stay on the same dialog.
Non-cancelling.
Cancellation.
Duelling.

children.functionDescription: This sub-function of the DialogSetLogicPath function creates the SpriteFont buttons for a dialog choice.
This functions sets a new text for the currently spawned dialog.
